definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
conscientious/earnest/serious/to take seriously/to take to heart
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to maintain (that sth is true)/to determine (a fact)/determination (of an amount)/of the firm opinion/to believe firmly/to set one's mind on/to identify with
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to undertake to purchase sth/to subscribe (to share issue)
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with

sentences.english: But Peter declared, "Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you."
sentences.chinese: 彼得說，我就是必須和你同死，也總不能不認你。

sentences.english: The magazine's stand is very hard to locate.
sentences.chinese: 這雜誌的立場觀點總是認人捉摸不定。

sentences.english: However, sometimes § The best solution is to recognize a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有些時候會氶認最好的解決方法就是離婚。

sentences.english: Most people would think that we have a good chance. I think we do.
sentences.chinese: 大多數人都認我們有很大的機率晉級，我也這麼認爲。

sentences.english: The oligarch, a bitter enemy of Putin, has denied any involvement.
sentences.chinese: 與普京有很大分歧的該政治寡頭則否認參與其中。

sentences.english: Mr. Jandali read the book and recognized himself in the father character.
sentences.chinese: 詹達利讀完小說之後認出書中父親一角正是自己。

sentences.english: I want him to identify him enemy Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 讓他當面認一下，他不共戴天的仇人唐伯虎。

sentences.english: Do you know anyone who punches a time clock?
sentences.chinese: 你認不認識曾經按過這種計時鐘的人呢？

sentences.english: The inscriptions on the bronze tripod can hardly be recognized, since it was made a long long ago.
sentences.chinese: 銅鼎上的款識由於年代久遠已經很難辨認。

sentences.english: His handwriting is too spidery to read.
sentences.chinese: 他的字跡太潦草很難辨認。

sentences.english: The close relationship between a harbor and its hinterland has long been recognized.
sentences.chinese: 一般鹹認港口與其腹地之間有非常密切的關係。

sentences.english: An aggressive man must be a go-getter.
sentences.chinese: 一個有進取心的認一定是個積極能幹的人。

sentences.english: Even if they did wrong they will feel that they were right.
sentences.chinese: 就算做錯了也不肯認，總是認爲自己纔是對的。

sentences.english: It's getting harder to read my scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我潦草的字跡越來越難辨認。

sentences.english: One's work is swept away when one becomes identified.
sentences.chinese: 一個人變得認同時，他的工作便一掃而空。

sentences.english: The handwriting was difficult to read, but the return address caught his attention.
sentences.chinese: 上面的筆記很難辨認，但是寄件地址吸引了他的注意。

definition: to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
definite/certain/fixed/to fix (on sth)/to determine/to be sure/to ensure/to make certain/to ascertain/to clinch/to recognize/to confirm/OK (on computer dialog box)
to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
to estimate/to reckon/CL:個|个[ge4]/(coll.) to suppose
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
